p: SARS-CoV-2 is a positive-sense single-stranded RNA (+)ssRNA) virus that can infect mammalian and avian hosts, where its nucleotide substitution rate is higher than their hosts ( Lin et al., 2019). At the whole genome level, the sequence identity of the SARS-CoV-2 was 50% to MERS-CoV, 79% to SARS-CoV, 88% to Bat-SL-CoVZC45 and Bat-SL-CoVZXC21, and 96% to Bat-SARSr-CoV RaTG13 ( Zhou et al., 2020). Genomic analyses of SARS-CoV-2 and 20 closely related coronavirus strains highlighted identical mutations in both the SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13, which could indicate that SARS-CoV-2 is probably originated from the Bat-SARSr-CoV RaTG13 ( Lv et al., 2020).
